required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Duowell® vs. Telmisartan Monotherapy in Mild Dyslipidemia Patients With Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open, Parallel, Multicenter, Phase 4 Study to Evaluate the Central Aortic Pressure Effect Between Fixed Dose Combination (Duowell® Tab) and Monotherapy of Telmisartan in Mild Dyslipidemia Patients With Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to evaluate effect and safety on central blood pressure with Duowell compared to telmisartan monotherapy in mild dyslipidemia patients with hypertension during 16 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in mean central systolic blood pressure

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in mean brachial systolic blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at week 4 and at week 16 and at week 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in mean brachial pulse pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at week 4 and at week 16 and and at week 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from mean brachial diastolic blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at week 4 and at week 16 and at week 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in augmentation index
Changes from baseline in carotid femoral pulse wave velocity

other_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in central blood pressure according to the frequency of access in mobile application
other_outcome.time_frame: up to 4 weeks and up to 16 weeks

other_outcome.measure: Drug compliance between over 50% and less 50% of assessment in mobile application
other_outcome.time_frame: at week 4 weeks and at week 16

other_outcome.measure: Drug compliance between over 50% and less 50% of assessment in mobile application
other_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 months end of study

other_outcome.measure: Changes from the end of treatment in central systolic blood pressure after 3 months
other_outcome.time_frame: at 3 months from the end of study

other_outcome.measure: Numbers of inconvenience reported by mobile application at each visit

intervention.description: telmisartan 80mg/rosuvastatin 10mg for ASCVD risk=5%~7.5% or telmisartan 80mg/rosuvastatin 20mg for ASCVD risk≥7.5%

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria (All of the followings)
- 40 to 75 years old diagnosed with hypertension
- at screening, SBP ≥ 140 mmHg
- at randomization, 130 mmHg ≤ SBP ≤160 mmHg or 80 mmHg ≤ DBP ≤ 100 mmHg
- at screening, ASCVD risk ≥ 5 %
- Those who did not take the dyslipidemic medications during screening or who stopped medication for more than 2 months
- at screening, 130 mg/dL ≤ Calculated (or Measured) Serum LDL-C ≤ 190 mg/dL
- Pregnancy test negative and and who has agreed to perform effective contraception during the clinical trial
Exclusion Criteria (Any of the followings)
- known hypersensitivity to AT-1 receptor blockers or statins
- Those who are treated with secondary hypertension during screening
- Those who are being treated for malignant hypertension during screening
- Those who are taking concurrent medication that may affect blood pressure during screening
- Those who have been diagnosed with myocardial infarction or unstable angina or stroke within the last 6 months at screening
- Patients with heart failure NYHA III-IV or Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction <40% within the last 6 months at screening
- Patients with valve disease with hemodynamically significant (over moderate degree) obstructive
- Those with known atrial fibrillation or atrioventricular conduction disturbance
- Those who show the following numerical values during the screening test
1. CPK ≥ 3 times the normal upper limit
2. Serum Creatinine > 3 mg/dL
3. Serum Potassium > 5.5 mmol/L
4. ALT or AST ≥ 3 times the upper normal limit
- Those with known bilateral renal artery stenosis
- Patients who underwent open heart surgery within 4 weeks prior to randomization and who had a cardiac surgery plan
- Those taking statins within 8 weeks before randomization
- Those with severe obstructive, limited or other pulmonary disease history
- Those with non-cardiac disease that can significantly shorten the expected life span to less than 2 years (eg, severe cancer)
- at screening, Anti-HIV Ab, HBsAg, HCV Ab positive

facility.name: The Catholic University of Korea, Bucheon ST. Mary's Hospital
Yonsei University Health System, SEVERANCE HOSPITAL
